   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: 
   26: -export([borderline/1, atomic/1,
   27:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   28:          zip_to_binary/1,
   29:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   30:          zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   31: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   32:          compress_control/1,
   33: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   34:          explicit_file_info/1, mode/1,
   35:          zip64_central_headers/1, unzip64_central_headers/1,
   36:          zip64_central_directory/1,
   37:          basic_timestamp/1, extended_timestamp/1,
   38:          uid_gid/1]).
   39: 
   40: -export([zip/5, unzip/3]).
   41: 
   42: -import(proplists,[get_value/2, get_value/3]).
   43: 
   44: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   45: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   46: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   47: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   48: 
   49: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   53:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   54:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases,
   55:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   56:      unzip_traversal_exploit, fd_leak, unicode, test_zip_dir,
   57:      explicit_file_info, {group, zip_group}, {group, zip64_group}].
   58: 
   59: groups() -> 
   60:     zip_groups().
   61: 
   62: %% zip   - Use zip unix tools
   63: %% ezip  - Use erlang zip on disk
   64: %% emzip - Use erlang zip in memory
   65: -define(ZIP_MODES,[zip, ezip, emzip]).
   66: %% -define(ZIP_MODES,[emzip]).
   67: -define(UNZIP_MODES,[unzip, unezip, unemzip]).
   68: %% How much memory the zip/unzip 64 testcases that zip/unzip from/to are expected to use
   69: -define(EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE, (8 * (1 bsl 30))).
   70: 
   71: zip_groups() ->
   72: 
   73:     ZipGroup=
   74:         [{zip_group,[],[{group,ZipMode} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   75:         [{ZipMode, [], [{group,UnZipMode} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   76:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   77:         [{G, [parallel], zip_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   78: 
   79:     Zip64Group = [{zip64_group,[],[{group,z64(ZipMode)} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   80:         [{z64(ZipMode), [sequence], [zip64_central_headers]++
   81:               [{group,z64(UnZipMode)} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   82:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   83:         [{z64(G), [], zip64_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   84: 
   85:     ZipGroup ++ Zip64Group.
   86: 
   87: z64(Mode) when is_atom(Mode) ->
   88:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([z64_,Mode]));
   89: z64(Modes) when is_list(Modes) ->
   90:     [z64(M) || M <- Modes].
   91: 
   92: un_z64(Mode) ->
   93:     case atom_to_list(Mode) of
   94:         "z64_" ++ ModeString -> list_to_atom(ModeString);
   95:         _ -> Mode
   96:     end.
   97: 
   98: zip_testcases() ->
   99:     [mode, basic_timestamp, extended_timestamp, uid_gid].
  100: 
  101: zip64_testcases() ->
  102:     [unzip64_central_headers,
  103:      zip64_central_directory].
  104: 
  105: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  106:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  107:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  108:     [{started, Started} | Config].
  109: 
  110: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  111:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(get_value(started, Config))],
  112:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  113:     ok.
  114: 
  115: cleanup_priv_dir(Config) ->
  116:     %% Cleanup potential files in priv_dir
  117:     [ case file:delete(File) of
  118:         {error, eperm} -> file:del_dir_r(File);
  119:         _ -> ok
  120:     end || File <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(get_value(priv_dir,Config), "*"))].
  121: 
  122: init_per_group(zip64_group, Config) ->
  123:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  124: 
  125:     case {erlang:system_info(wordsize), disc_free(PrivDir), memsize()} of
  126:         {4, _, _} ->
  127:             {skip, "Zip64 tests only work on 64-bit systems"};
  128:         {8, error, _} ->
  129:             {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
  130:              "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
  131:         {8, N,M} when N >= 16 * (1 bsl 20), M >= ?EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE ->
  132:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  133:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [M div (1 bsl 20)]),
  134:             OneMB = <<0:(8 bsl 20)>>,
  135:             Large4GB = filename:join(PrivDir, "large.txt"),
  136:             ok = file:write_file(Large4GB, lists:duplicate(4 bsl 10, OneMB)),
  137:             Medium4MB = filename:join(PrivDir, "medium.txt"),
  138:             ok = file:write_file(Medium4MB, lists:duplicate(4, OneMB)),
  139: 
  140:             [{large, Large4GB},{medium,Medium4MB}|Config];
  141:         {8,N,M} ->
  142:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  143:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [M div (1 bsl 20)]),
  144:             {skip,"Less than 16 GByte free disk or less then 8 GB free mem"}
  145:     end;
  146: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
  147:     case lists:member(Group, ?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES ++ z64(?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES)) of
  148:         true ->
  149:             case get_value(zip, Config) of
  150:                 undefined ->
  151:                     case un_z64(Group) =/= zip orelse has_zip() of
  152:                         true ->
  153:                             Pdir = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),Group),
  154:                             ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  155:                             [{pdir, Pdir},{zip, Group} | Config];
  156:                         false ->
  157:                             {skip, "No zip program found"}
  158:                     end;
  159:                 _Zip ->
  160:                     case un_z64(Group) =/= unzip orelse has_zip() of
  161:                         true ->
  162:                             Pdir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config),Group),
  163:                             ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  164:                             [{pdir, Pdir},{unzip, Group} | Config];
  165:                         false ->
  166:                             {skip, "No zip program found"}
  167:                     end
  168:             end;
  169:         false ->
  170:             Config
  171:     end.
  172: 
  173: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  174:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  175:     Config.
  176: 
  177: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) ->
  178:     UsesZip = un_z64(get_value(zip, Config)) =:= zip orelse un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =:= unzip,
  179:     HasZip = has_zip(),
  180:     ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [memsize() div (1 bsl 20)]),
  181:     if UsesZip andalso not HasZip ->
  182:             {skip, "No zip command found"};
  183:        true ->
  184:             PrivDir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config,get_value(priv_dir, Config)), TC),
  185:             ok = filelib:ensure_path(PrivDir),
  186:             [{pdir, PrivDir} | Config]
  187:     end.
  188: 
  189: 
  190: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  191:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  192:     Config.
  193: 
  194: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
  195: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
  196: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
  197: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  198:     RootDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  199:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
  200: 
  201:     Record = 512,
  202:     Block = 20 * Record,
  203: 
  204:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
  205:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
  206:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
  207:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
  208:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
  209: 
  210:     %% Clean up.
  211:     delete_files([TempDir]),
  212:     ok.
  213: 
  214: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
  215:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
  216:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
  217:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  218: 
  219:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  220:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  221:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  222:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
  223:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  224: 
  225:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  226:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
  227:           #zip_file{name = Name,
  228:                     info = Info,
  229:                     offset = 0,
  230:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  231:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  232:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  233: 
  234:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  235:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  236:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  237: 
  238: 
  239:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  240:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  241: 
  242:     ok.
  243: 
  244: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  245:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  246:         true ->
  247:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  248:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  249:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  250:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  251:         _ ->
  252:             ok
  253:     end.
  254: 
  255: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  256:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  257: 
  258: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  259:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  260:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  261: 
  262: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  263:     receive
  264:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  265:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  266:         {Port, eof} ->
  267:             Port ! {self(), close},
  268:             receive
  269:                 {Port, closed} ->
  270:                     true
  271:             end,
  272:             receive
  273:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  274:                     ok
  275:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  276:                     ok
  277:             end,
  278:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  279:     end.
  280: 
  281: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  282:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  283: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  284:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  285: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  286:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  287: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  288:     ok.
  289: 
  290: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  291:     unlink(Port),
  292:     exit(Port, die),
  293:     ct:fail(Reason).
  294: 
  295: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  296:     Cmd.
  297: %%     case os:type() of
  298: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  299: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  300: %%     end.
  301: 
  302: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  303: 
  304: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  305:     X = next_random(X0),
  306:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  307:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  308:         _ -> false
  309:     end;
  310: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  311:     true.
  312: 
  313: %% Generates a random byte list.
  314: 
  315: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  316:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  317: 
  318: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  319:     X = next_random(X0),
  320:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  321: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  322:     lists:reverse(Result).
  323: 
  324: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  325: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  326: 
  327: next_random(X) ->
  328:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  329: 
  330: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  331: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  332: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  333:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  334:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  335:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  336:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  337: 
  338:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  339: 
  340:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  341:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  342:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  343: 
  344:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  345: 
  346:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  347:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  348:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  349:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  350: 
  351:     %% Clean up.
  352:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  353: 
  354:     ok.
  355: 
  356: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  357: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  358: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  359:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  360:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  361:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  362:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  363: 
  364:     %% Create a zip archive
  365:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  366:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  367: 
  368:     %% Open archive
  369:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  370: 
  371:     %% List dir
  372:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  373: 
  374:     %% Get a file
  375:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  376:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  377:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  378:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  379:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  380: 
  381:     %% Get all files
  382:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  383:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  384:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  385: 
  386:     %% Close
  387:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  388: 
  389:     %% Clean up.
  390:     delete_files([Names]),
  391: 
  392:     ok.
  393: 
  394: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  395: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  396: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  397: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     %% Create a zip archive
  399:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  400:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  401: 
  402:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  403:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  404: 
  405:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  406:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  407: 
  408:     %% Clean up.
  409:     delete_files([Zip]),
  410: 
  411:     ok.
  412: 
  413: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  414:     Self = self(),
  415:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  416:     receive
  417:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  418:             ZipSrv
  419:     end.
  420: 
  421: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  422:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  423:     receive
  424:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  425:             true
  426:     after 1000 ->
  427:             false
  428:     end.
  429: 
  430: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  431: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  432:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  433:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  434:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  435: 
  436:     %% create a temp directory
  437:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  438:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  439: 
  440:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  441: 
  442:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  443:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  444: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  445: 
  446:     %% Verify.
  447:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  448:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  449: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  450: 		  FList),
  451:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  452: 		  RetList),
  453: 
  454:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  455:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  456: 
  457:     FList2 = ["abc.txt","quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  458: 
  459:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  460:     {ok, RetList2} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories]),
  461: 
  462:     %% Verify.
  463:     true = (length(RetList2) =:= 4),
  464:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  465: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  466: 		  FList2),
  467:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> 1 = delete_files([F]) end,
  468: 		  RetList2),
  469: 
  470:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  471:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  472:     ok.
  473: 
  474: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  475: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  476:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  477:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  478:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  479: 
  480:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  481:     %% clash.txt
  482:     %% ../clash.txt
  483:     %% ../above.txt
  484:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  485: 
  486:     %% create a temp directory
  487:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  488:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  489:     
  490:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  491:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  492:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  493: 
  494:     %% unzip in SubDir
  495:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  496: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  497: 
  498:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  499: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  500:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  501:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  502: 
  503:     %% clean up
  504:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  505:     
  506:      %% create the temp directory again
  507:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  508: 
  509:     %% unzip in SubDir
  510:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  511: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  512: 
  513:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  514: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  515:    
  516:     %% clean up
  517:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  518:     ok.
  519: 
  520: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  521: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  522:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  523:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  524:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  525: 
  526:     %% create a temp directory
  527:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  528:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  529: 
  530:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  531: 
  532:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile, [{cwd, Subdir}]),
  533: 
  534:     %% Verify.
  535:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  536: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  537: 		  FList),
  538:     lists:foreach(fun(F)->
  539:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  540:                               true -> ok = file:del_dir(F);
  541:                               false -> ok = file:delete(F)
  542:                           end
  543:                   end,
  544: 		  lists:reverse(RetList)),
  545: 
  546:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  547:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  548:     ok.
  549: 
  550: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  551: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  552:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  553:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  554:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  555:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  556: 
  557:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  558:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  559: 
  560:     %% Create a zip archive
  561:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  562:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  563: 
  564:     %% Open archive
  565:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  566: 
  567:     %% List dir
  568:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  569: 
  570:     %% Get a file
  571:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  572:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  573:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  574: 
  575:     %% Get all files
  576:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  577:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  578:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  579: 
  580:     %% Close
  581:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  582: 
  583:     %% Clean up.
  584:     delete_files([Names]),
  585: 
  586:     ok.
  587: 
  588: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  589: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  590: 
  591:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  592:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  593: 
  594:     {ok,
  595:      ["abc.txt", "quotes/rain.txt", "empty/", "wikipedia.txt", "emptyFile" ]} =
  596:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[names_only]),
  597: 
  598:     {ok,
  599:      [#zip_comment{},
  600:       #zip_file{ name = "abc.txt" },
  601:       #zip_file{ name = "quotes/rain.txt" },
  602:       #zip_file{ name = "wikipedia.txt" },
  603:       #zip_file{ name = "emptyFile" }
  604:      ]} =  zip:list_dir(Archive,[skip_directories]),
  605: 
  606:     ok.
  607: 
  608: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  609: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  610:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  611: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  612:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  613:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  614: 
  615: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  616: char_seq(N, First) ->
  617:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  618: 
  619: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  620:     Result;
  621: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  622:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  623: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  624:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  625: 
  626: data_files() ->
  627:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  628:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  629:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  630:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  631:     create_files(Files),
  632:     Files.
  633: 
  634: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  635:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  636:     create_files(Rest);
  637: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  638:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  639:     create_files(Rest);
  640: create_files([]) ->
  641:     ok.
  642:

  647: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  648: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  649: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  650: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  651: %%     Dir.

  653: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  654: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  655:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  656:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  657:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  658:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  659:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  660:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  661:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  662:                           {ok, O} = zip:zip_open(A, []),
  663:                           zip:zip_get("not_here", O)
  664:                   end,
  665:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  666:     ok.
  667: 
  668: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  669:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  670:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  671: 
  672: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  673:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  674: 
  675:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  676:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  677:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  678:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  679:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  680:     case What(Full) of
  681:         Expected ->
  682:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  683:         Other ->
  684:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  685:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  686:     end.
  687:

  689: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  690:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  691:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  692:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),

  694:     _ = file:make_dir(filename:join(DataDir, "empty")),

  698: 
  699:     %% Unzip a zip file into a binary
  700:     {ok, FBList} = zip:unzip(Long, [memory]),

  702:     %% Verify.

  704:                           Filename = filename:join(DataDir, F),

  706:                               true ->

  709:                                       file:read_file_info(Filename);

  792:

  799:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  800:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  801:

  803:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),

  812:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]}
  813:         = zip:unzip(Bin, [skip_directories]),

  815:     %% Verify.

  817:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  818:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  819: 
  820:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  821:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  822:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  823: 
  824:     %% Clean up.
  825:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, ExtractDir]),
  826:

  829: %% oac_files() ->
  830: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  831: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  832: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  833: %%     create_files(Files),
  834: %%     Files.
  835: 
  836: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  837: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  838: delete_files(List) ->
  839:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  840: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  841:     Cnt;
  842: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  843:     case file:delete(Item) of
  844:         ok ->
  845:             DelCnt = 1;
  846:         {error,eperm} ->
  847:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  848:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  849:             file:del_dir(Item);
  850:         {error,eacces} ->
  851:             %% We'll see about that!
  852:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  853:             case file:delete(Item) of
  854:                 ok ->
  855: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  856:                 {error,_} ->
  857:                     erlang:yield(),
  858:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  859:                     file:delete(Item),
  860:                     DelCnt = 1
  861:             end;
  862:         {error,_} ->
  863:             DelCnt = 0
  864:     end,
  865:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  866: 
  867: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  868: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  869:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  870:     Dir = "compress_control",
  871:     Files = [
  872:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  873:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  874:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  875:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  876:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  877:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  878:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  879:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  880:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  881:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  882:             ],
  883: 
  884:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  885: 			  Files,
  886: 			  [{compress, []}],
  887: 			  []),
  888: 
  889:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  890: 			  Files,
  891: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  892: 			  []),
  893: 
  894:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  895: 			  Files,
  896: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  897: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  898: 
  899:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  900: 			  Files,
  901: 			  [],
  902: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  903: 
  904:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  905: 			  Files,
  906: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  907: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  908: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  909: 
  910:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  911: 			  Files,
  912: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  913: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  914: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  915: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  916: 
  917:     ok.
  918: 
  919: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  920:     %% Cleanup
  921:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  922:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  923:     delete_files([Zip]),
  924:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  925: 
  926:     create_files(Files),
  927:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  928: 
  929:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  930:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:zip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  931:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  932:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  933:     ok = zip:zip_close(OpenZip),
  934: 
  935:     %% Cleanup
  936:     delete_files([Zip]),
  937:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  938: 
  939:     ok.
  940: 
  941: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  942:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  943:         case Kind of
  944:             dir ->
  945:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  946:             _   ->
  947:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:zip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  948:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  949:         end,
  950:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  951:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  952: 
  953:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  954:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  955:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  956:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  957:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  958:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  959:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  960:     end,
  961:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  962: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  963:     ok.
  964: 
  965: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  966:     false;
  967: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  968:     CompressOpt =
  969:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  970:             [] -> all;
  971:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  972:         end,
  973:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  974:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  975:     UncompressOpt =
  976:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  977:             [] -> Default;
  978:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  979:         end,
  980:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  981:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  982: 
  983: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  984:     case H of
  985:         all ->
  986:             extensions(T, H);
  987:         H when is_list(H) ->
  988:             extensions(T, H);
  989:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  990:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  991:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  992:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  993:         _ ->
  994:             extensions(T, Old)
  995:     end;
  996: extensions([], Old) ->
  997:     Old.
  998: 
  999: foldl(Config) ->
 1000:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1001:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
 1002: 
 1003:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
 1004:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
 1005:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
 1006:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory,{extra,[]}]),
 1007:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
 1008:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
 1009:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
 1010:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory,{extra,[]}]),
 1011:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
 1012: 	try
 1013: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
 1014: 	catch
 1015: 	    throw:FooBin ->
 1016: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
 1017: 	end,
 1018:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 1019:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1020: 
 1021:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
 1022:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
 1023:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
 1024: 
 1025:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1026:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1027: 
 1028:     ok.
 1029: 
 1030: fd_leak(Config) ->
 1031:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1032:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1033:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
 1034:     BadExtract = fun() ->
 1035:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
 1036:                          ok
 1037:                  end,
 1038:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
 1039: 
 1040:     BadCreate = fun() ->
 1041:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
 1042:                                                  ["none"]),
 1043:                         ok
 1044:                 end,
 1045:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
 1046: 
 1047:     ok.
 1048: 
 1049: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
 1050:     ok;
 1051: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
 1052:     try Bad() of
 1053:         ok ->
 1054:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
 1055:     catch
 1056:         C:R:Stk ->
 1057:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
 1058:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1059:     end.
 1060: 
 1061: unicode(Config) ->
 1062:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1063:         latin1 ->
 1064:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
 1065:         utf8 ->
 1066:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1067:             ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1068:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
 1069:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
 1070:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
 1071:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
 1072:             case has_zip() of
 1073:                 false ->
 1074:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
 1075:                 true ->
 1076:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
 1077:                         true ->
 1078:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
 1079:                             ok;
 1080:                         false ->
 1081:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
 1082:                     end
 1083:             end
 1084:     end.
 1085: 
 1086: test_filename_compatibility() ->
 1087:     FancyName = "üñíĉòdë한",
 1088:     Archive = "test.zip",
 1089: 
 1090:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
 1091:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
 1092: 
 1093: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
 1094:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
 1095:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
 1096:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
 1097:     [begin
 1098:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
 1099:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
 1100:      end ||
 1101:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
 1102:     ok.
 1103: 
 1104: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1105:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1106:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1107:               [FileName, Comment]),
 1108:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1109:     {ok, Archive} =
 1110:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1111:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
 1112: 
 1113: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1114:     case test_zip1() of
 1115:         false ->
 1116:             ok;
 1117:         true ->
 1118:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1119:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1120:                       [FileName, Comment]),
 1121:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1122:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
 1123:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1124:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
 1125:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
 1126:     end.
 1127: 
 1128: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
 1129:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
 1130:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
 1131:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
 1132:     ok.
 1133: 
 1134: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
 1135:     case test_zip1() of
 1136:         false ->
 1137:             ok;
 1138:         true ->
 1139:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1140:             FileName = "a.txt",
 1141:             Comment = [Char],
 1142:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
 1143:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1144: 
 1145:             {ok, _} =
 1146:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1147:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
 1148:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
 1149:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
 1150: 
 1151:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
 1152:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1153:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
 1154:     end.
 1155: 
 1156: test_zip1() ->
 1157:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
 1158: 
 1159: has_zip() ->
 1160:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false andalso element(1, os:type()) =:= unix.
 1161: 
 1162: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1163:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1164:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1165: 
 1166: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1167:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1168:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1169:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1170:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1171:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1172:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1173:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1174:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1175:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1176:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1177:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1178:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1179:     ok.
 1180: 
 1181: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1182:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1183:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1184:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1185:     Comment = [9999999],
 1186:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1187:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1188: 
 1189: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1190:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1191:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1192:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1193:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1194: 
 1195: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1196:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1197:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1198:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1199:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1200:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1201:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1202:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1203:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1204:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1205:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1206:             ok;
 1207:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1208:     end.
 1209: 
 1210: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1211:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1212:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1213:              receive
 1214:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1215:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1216:                               Reciver()
 1217:              end
 1218:      end)().
 1219:     
 1220: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1221:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1222:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1223:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1224:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1225:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1226:     ok.
 1227: 
 1228: mode(Config) ->
 1229: 
 1230:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1231:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1232:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1233: 
 1234:     Executable = filename:join(PrivDir,"exec"),
 1235:     file:write_file(Executable, "aaa"),
 1236:     {ok, ExecFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1237:     ok = file:write_file_info(Executable, ExecFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1238:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode }} = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1239: 
 1240:     Directory = filename:join(PrivDir,"dir"),
 1241:     ok = file:make_dir(Directory),
 1242:     {ok, DirFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1243:     ok = file:write_file_info(Directory, DirFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1244:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode }} = file:read_file_info(Directory),
 1245: 
 1246:     ?assertMatch(
 1247:        {ok, Archive},
 1248:        zip(Config, Archive, "-r", ["dir","exec"], [{cwd, PrivDir},{extra,[extended_timestamp]}])),
 1249: 
 1250:     OrigExecMode777 = OrigExecMode band 8#777,
 1251:     OrigDirMode777 = OrigDirMode band 8#777,
 1252: 
 1253:     ?assertMatch(
 1254:        {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1255:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode777 }},
 1256:              #zip_file{ name = "exec", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode777 }} ]},
 1257:        zip:list_dir(Archive)),
 1258: 
 1259:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1260:     ?assertMatch(
 1261:        {ok, ["dir/","exec"]}, unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1262: 
 1263:     case un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =/= unemzip of
 1264:         true ->
 1265:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = ExecMode }} =
 1266:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"exec")),
 1267:             ?assertEqual(ExecMode band 8#777, OrigExecMode777),
 1268: 
 1269:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = DirMode }} =
 1270:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir")),
 1271:             ?assertEqual(DirMode band 8#777, OrigDirMode777);
 1272:         false ->
 1273:             %% emzip does not support mode
 1274:             ok
 1275:     end,
 1276: 
 1277:     ok.
 1278: 
 1279: %% Test that zip64 local and central headers are respected when unzipping.
 1280: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1281: %%  * compressed size
 1282: %%  * uncompressed size
 1283: %%  * relative offset
 1284: %%  * starting disk
 1285: %%
 1286: %% As we do not support using multiple disks, we do not test starting disks
 1287: zip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1288: 
 1289:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1290:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../archive.zip"),
 1291: 
 1292:     %% Check that ../../large.txt exists and is of correct size
 1293:     {ok, #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } } =
 1294:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt")),
 1295: 
 1296:     %% We very carefully create an archive that should contain all
 1297:     %% different header combinations.
 1298:     %% - uncomp.txt: uncomp size > 4GB
 1299:     %% - uncomp.comp.zip: uncomp and comp size > 4GB
 1300:     %% - offset.txt: offset > 4GB
 1301:     %% - uncomp.offset.txt: uncomp size and offset > 4GB
 1302:     %% - uncomp.comp.offset.zip: uncomp and comp size and offset > 4GB
 1303:     %%
 1304:     %% The archive will be roughly 8 GBs large
 1305: 
 1306:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1307:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.txt")),
 1308:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1309:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.zip")),
 1310:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../medium.txt"),
 1311:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "offset.txt")),
 1312:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1313:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.offset.txt")),
 1314:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1315:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.offset.zip")),
 1316:     ?assertMatch(
 1317:        {ok, Archive},
 1318:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1",
 1319:            ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip","offset.txt",
 1320:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"],
 1321:            [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1322: 
 1323:     %% Check that list archive works
 1324:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1325:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.txt",
 1326:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1327:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.zip",
 1328:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1329:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1330:           #zip_file{ name = "offset.txt",
 1331:                      info = #file_info{ size = 4 bsl 20 } },
 1332:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.offset.txt",
 1333:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1334:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.offset.zip",
 1335:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1336:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } }
 1337:          ]} =
 1338:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1339:     ok.
 1340: 
 1341: unzip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1342: 
 1343:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1344:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1345:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../../archive.zip"),
 1346:     Large4GB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),"large.txt"),
 1347:     Medium4MB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config), "medium.txt"),
 1348: 
 1349:     %% Test that extraction of each file works
 1350:     lists:map(
 1351:       fun F({Name, Compare}) ->
 1352:               ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1353:               ?assertMatch(
 1354:                  {ok, [Name]},
 1355:                  unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,[Name]}])),
 1356:               cmp(Compare, filename:join(ExtractDir,Name)),
 1357:               file:del_dir_r(ExtractDir);
 1358:           F(Name) ->
 1359:               F({Name, Large4GB})
 1360:       end, ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip",{"offset.txt",Medium4MB},
 1361:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"]),
 1362: 
 1363:     ok.
 1364: 
 1365: %% Test that zip64 end of central directory are respected when unzipping.
 1366: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1367: %%   * total number of files > 2 bytes
 1368: %%   * size of central directory > 4 bytes (cannot test as it requires an archive with 8 million files)
 1369: %%   * offset of central directory > 4 bytes (implicitly tested when testing large relative location of header)
 1370: %%
 1371: %% Fields that we don't test as we don't support multiple disks
 1372: %%   * number of disk where end of central directory is > 2 bytes
 1373: %%   * number of disk to find central directory > 2 bytes
 1374: %%   * number central directory entries on this disk > 2 bytes
 1375: zip64_central_directory(Config) ->
 1376: 
 1377:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1378:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "files"),
 1379:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1380: 
 1381:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1382: 
 1383:     %% To test when total number of files > 65535, we create an archive with 66000 entries
 1384:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1385:     lists:foreach(
 1386:       fun(I) ->
 1387:               ok = file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, integer_to_list(I)++".txt"),<<0:8>>)
 1388:       end, lists:seq(0, 65600)),
 1389:     ?assertMatch(
 1390:        {ok, Archive},
 1391:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1 -r", ["files"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1392: 
 1393:     {ok, Files} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1394:     ?assertEqual(65603, length(Files)),
 1395: 
 1396:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1397:     ?assertMatch(
 1398:        {ok, ["files/1.txt","files/65599.txt"]},
 1399:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,["files/1.txt",
 1400:                                                              "files/65599.txt"]}])),
 1401:     cmp(filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/1.txt"),
 1402:         filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/65599.txt")),
 1403: 
 1404:     ok.
 1405: 
 1406: %% Test basic timestamps, the atime and mtime should be the original
 1407: %% mtime of the file
 1408: basic_timestamp(Config) ->
 1409:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1410:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1411:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1412:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1413: 
 1414:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1415:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1416:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1417: 
 1418:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1419:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1420: 
 1421:     %% Create an archive without extended timestamps
 1422:     ?assertMatch(
 1423:        {ok, Archive},
 1424:        zip(Config, Archive, "-X", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}, {extra, []}])),
 1425: 
 1426:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1427:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime }} ]} =
 1428:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1429: 
 1430:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1431:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1432:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1433: 
 1434:     %% Timestamp in archive is when entry was added to archive
 1435:     %% Need to add 2 to ZMtime as the dos time in zip archives
 1436:     %% are in precise.
 1437:     ?assert(calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(Mtime) =<
 1438:                 calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(ZMtime) + 1),
 1439: 
 1440:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1441:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1442: 
 1443:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1444:     ?assertMatch(
 1445:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1446:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1447: 
 1448:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1449:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1450:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1451:                              }} =
 1452:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt"),[raw]),
 1453: 
 1454: 
 1455:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1456: 
 1457:     UnzipMode = un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)),
 1458: 
 1459:     if UnzipMode =/= unemzip ->
 1460:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1461: 
 1462:             %% When using unzip, the atime is sometimes set to ctime for unknown reasons... so we cannot test it
 1463:             %% ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1464: 
 1465:             %% On windows the ctime and mtime are the same so
 1466:             %% we cannot compare them.
 1467:             [?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime) || os:type() =/= {win32,nt}];
 1468:         UnzipMode =:= unemzip ->
 1469:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1470:             ok
 1471:     end,
 1472: 
 1473:     ok.
 1474: 
 1475: %% Test extended timestamps, the atime and ctime in the archive are
 1476: %% the atime and ctime when the file is added to the archive.
 1477: extended_timestamp(Config) ->
 1478: 
 1479:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1480:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1481:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1482:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1483: 
 1484:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1485:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1486:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1487: 
 1488:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1489:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1490: 
 1491:     ?assertMatch(
 1492:        {ok, Archive},
 1493:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1494: 
 1495:     %% list_dir only reads the central directory header and thus only
 1496:     %% the mtime will be correct here
 1497:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1498:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime}} ]} =
 1499:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1500: 
 1501:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1502:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1503:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1504: 
 1505:     ?assertEqual(Mtime, ZMtime),
 1506: 
 1507:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1508:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1509: 
 1510:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1511:     ?assertMatch(
 1512:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1513:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1514: 
 1515:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1516:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1517:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1518:                              }} =
 1519:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt"),[raw]),
 1520: 
 1521:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1522: 
 1523:     UnzipMode = un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)),
 1524: 
 1525:     if UnzipMode =/= unemzip ->
 1526:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1527: 
 1528:             %% When using unzip, the atime is sometimes set to ctime for unknown reasons... so we cannot test it
 1529:             %% ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1530: 
 1531:             %% On windows the ctime and mtime are the same so
 1532:             %% we cannot compare them.
 1533:             [?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime) || os:type() =/= {win32,nt}];
 1534:         UnzipMode =:= unemzip ->
 1535:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1536:             ok
 1537:     end,
 1538: 
 1539:     ok.
 1540: 
 1541: uid_gid(Config) ->
 1542: 
 1543:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1544:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1545:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1546:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1547: 
 1548:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1549:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ gid = GID, uid = UID }} =
 1550:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1551: 
 1552:     ?assertMatch(
 1553:        {ok, Archive},
 1554:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1555: 
 1556:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1557:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ gid = ZGID, uid = ZUID }} ]} =
 1558:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[{extra, [uid_gid]}]),
 1559: 
 1560:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1561:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1562: 
 1563:     ?assertEqual(UID, ZUID),
 1564:     ?assertEqual(GID, ZGID),
 1565: 
 1566:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1567:     ?assertMatch(
 1568:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1569:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{extra,[uid_gid]}])),
 1570: 
 1571:     {ok,#file_info{ gid = ExZGID, uid = ExZUID }} =
 1572:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"testfile.txt")),
 1573: 
 1574:     case un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =/= unemzip of
 1575:         true ->
 1576:             ?assertEqual(UID, ExZUID),
 1577:             ?assertEqual(GID, ExZGID);
 1578:         _ ->
 1579:             %% emzip does not support uid_gid
 1580:             ok
 1581:     end,
 1582: 
 1583:     ok.
 1584: 
 1585: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1586: %%% Generic zip interface
 1587: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1588: zip(Config, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1589:     zip(get_value(zip, Config),
 1590:         Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1591: zip(z64_zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1592:     zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1593: zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1594:     cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1595:         "zip "++ZipOpts++" "++Archive++" "++lists:join($ ,Filelist)),
 1596:     {ok, Archive};
 1597: zip(z64_ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1598:     zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1599: zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1600:     ct:log("Creating zip:zip(~p,~n~p,~n~p)",[Archive, Filelist, Opts]),
 1601:     zip:zip(Archive, Filelist, Opts);
 1602: zip(z64_emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1603:     %% Run in peer node so that memory issues don't crash test node
 1604:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => emzip_peer_args() }),
 1605:     try
 1606:         erpc:call(
 1607:           Node,
 1608:           fun() ->
 1609:             ?MODULE:zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts)
 1610:           end)
 1611:     after
 1612:         peer:stop(Peer)
 1613:     end;
 1614: zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1615:     ct:log("Creating emzip ~ts",[Archive]),
 1616:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts),
 1617: 
 1618:     
 1619:     %% For this not to use a huge amount of memory we re-use
 1620:     %% the binary for files that are the same size as those are the same file.
 1621:     %% This cuts memory usage from ~16GB to ~4GB.
 1622: 
 1623:     {Files,_Cache} =
 1624:         lists:mapfoldl(
 1625:         fun F(Fn, Cache) ->
 1626:                 AbsFn = filename:join(Cwd, Fn),
 1627:                 {ok, Fi} = file:read_file_info(AbsFn),
 1628:                 CacheKey = {Fi#file_info.type, Fi#file_info.size},
 1629:                 {SubDirFiles, NewCache} =
 1630:                     if Fi#file_info.type == directory ->
 1631:                             {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(AbsFn),
 1632:                             lists:mapfoldl(F, Cache#{ CacheKey => <<>> },
 1633:                                             [filename:join(Fn, DirFn) || DirFn <- Files]);
 1634:                         Fi#file_info.type == regular ->
 1635:                             {[],
 1636:                                 case maps:find(CacheKey, Cache) of
 1637:                                     {ok, _} -> Cache;
 1638:                                     error ->
 1639:                                         {ok, Data} = read_file(
 1640:                                                     file:open(AbsFn, [read, raw, binary]),
 1641:                                                     Fi#file_info.size),
 1642:                                         Cache#{ CacheKey => Data }
 1643:                                 end}
 1644:                     end,
 1645:                 {[{Fn, maps:get(CacheKey, NewCache), Fi}|SubDirFiles], NewCache}
 1646:         end,  #{}, Filelist),
 1647:     zip:zip(Archive, lists:flatten(Files), proplists:delete(cwd,Opts)).
 1648: 
 1649: %% Special read_file that works on windows on > 4 GB files
 1650: read_file({ok, D}, Size) ->
 1651:     Bin = iolist_to_binary(read_file(D, Size)),
 1652:     erlang:garbage_collect(), %% Do a GC to get rid of all intermediate binaries
 1653:     {ok, Bin};
 1654: read_file({error, _} = E, _Size) ->
 1655:     E;
 1656: read_file(eof = E, _Size) ->
 1657:     E;
 1658: read_file(D, 0) ->
 1659:     file:close(D),
 1660:     [];
 1661: read_file(D, Size) ->
 1662:     {ok, B} = file:read(D, min(1 bsl 30, Size)),
 1663:     [B | read_file(D, Size - byte_size(B))].
 1664: 
 1665: unzip(Config, Archive, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1666:     unzip(get_value(unzip, Config), Archive, Opts);
 1667: unzip(z64_unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1668:     unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts);
 1669: unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1670:     UidGid = [" -X " || lists:member(uid_gid, get_value(extra, Opts, []))],
 1671:     Files = lists:join($ , get_value(file_list, Opts, [])),
 1672:     Res = cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1673:               "unzip "++UidGid++" "++Archive++" "++Files),
 1674:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1675:            lists:flatmap(
 1676:              fun(Ln) ->
 1677:                      case re:run(Ln, ~B'\s+[a-z]+: ([^\s]+)', [{capture,all_but_first,list},unicode]) of
 1678:                          nomatch -> [];
 1679:                          {match,Match} -> Match
 1680:                      end
 1681:              end,string:split(Res,"\n",all)))};
 1682: unzip(z64_unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1683:     unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts);
 1684: unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1685:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1686:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, Opts),
 1687:     {ok, lists:sort([F -- Cwd || F <- Files])};
 1688: unzip(z64_unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1689:     %% Run in peer node so that memory issues don't crash test node
 1690:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => emzip_peer_args() }),
 1691:     try
 1692:       erpc:call(
 1693:         Node,
 1694:         fun() ->
 1695:             unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts)
 1696:         end)
 1697:     after
 1698:         peer:stop(Peer)
 1699:     end;
 1700: unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1701:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1702:     
 1703:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory | Opts]),
 1704:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1705:             [begin
 1706:                 case lists:last(F) of
 1707:                     $/ ->
 1708:                         filelib:ensure_path(F);
 1709:                     _ ->
 1710:                         filelib:ensure_dir(F),
 1711:                         file:write_file(F, B)
 1712:                 end,
 1713:                 F -- Cwd
 1714:             end || {F, B} <- Files])}.
 1715: 
 1716: emzip_peer_args() ->
 1717:     8 = erlang:system_info(wordsize),%% Supercarrier only supported on 64-bit
 1718:     ["+MMscs",integer_to_list(?EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE div (1024 * 1024))].
 1719: 
 1720: cmp(Source, Target) ->
 1721:     {ok, SrcInfo} = file:read_file_info(Source),
 1722:     {ok, TgtInfo} = file:read_file_info(Target),
 1723:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.size, TgtInfo#file_info.size),
 1724:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.mode, TgtInfo#file_info.mode),
 1725: 
 1726:     {ok, Src} = file:open(Source, [read, binary]),
 1727:     {ok, Tgt} = file:open(Target, [read, binary]),
 1728: 
 1729:     cmp(Src, Tgt, 0),
 1730: 
 1731:     file:close(Src),
 1732:     file:close(Tgt).
 1733: 
 1734: %% Check if first 100 MB are the same
 1735: cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos) when Pos < 100 bsl 20 ->
 1736:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1737:     case {file:read(Src, 20 bsl 20), file:read(Tgt, 20 bsl 20)} of
 1738:         {{ok, Data}, {ok, Data}} ->
 1739:             cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos + 20 bsl 20);
 1740:         {E, E} ->
 1741:             ok
 1742:     end;
 1743: cmp(_Src, _Tgt, _) ->
 1744:     ok.
 1745: 
 1746: cmd(Cmd) ->
 1747:     Res = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1748:     ct:log("Cmd: ~ts~nRes: ~ts~n",[Cmd, Res]),
 1749:     Res.
 1750: 
 1751: disc_free(Path) ->
 1752:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 1753: 
 1754:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 1755:     Partitions =
 1756:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 1757:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 1758: 
 1759:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 1760:     %% path first.
 1761:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 1762:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 1763:         [] -> error
 1764:     end.
 1765: 
 1766: memsize() ->
 1767:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1768:         undefined ->
 1769:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1770:             Tot;
 1771:         Available ->
 1772:             Available
 1773:     end.
